correct_answer: In order to receive new car replacement cover, the insured must be the first and only registered keeper of the car, and the car must be less than 1 year old with Comprehensive cover or less than 2 years old with Comprehensive Plus cover when it's stolen or damaged.
LLM Answers: To receive new car replacement cover, your car must be less than 2 years old when it’s stolen or damaged. We will replace your car with one of the same make and model if it has been reported as stolen to the police and has not been found, or if it has suffered damage that this policy covers and the cost of repairing it is more than 60% of the last UK list price (including taxes).
LLM T Answers: To receive new car replacement cover, your car must be less than 2 years old when it’s stolen or damaged. If your car has been reported as stolen to the police and has not been found, or if it has suffered damage that this policy covers and the cost of repairing it is more than 60% of the last UK list price (including taxes), then you may be eligible for a replacement with a car of the same make and model. If a suitable replacement car is not available or your car was not supplied as new in the UK, you may receive the market value of your car at the time it was stolen or damaged.
